bibl.title: Incestuous and Close-Kin Marriage in Ancient Egypt and Persia. An Examination of the Evidence. (C.N.I. Publications. 34.)
bibl.publisher: The Carsten Niebuhr Institute of Near Eastern Studies
bibl.note: Preface. - Introductory remarks. - The universalist view. - The practice of incest [see pp. 48-60: Graeco-Roman Egypt: Economics; - 'Salonfähig'; - 'Camp'-mentality; - Other explanations - and the Greeks]. - Concluding remarks. - Bibliography. Indices.
FRANDSEN Paul John, Incestuous and Close-Kin Marriage in Ancient Egypt and Persia. An Examination of the Evidence. (C.N.I. Publications. 34.)
Copenhagen, The Carsten Niebuhr Institute of Near Eastern Studies, University of Copenhagen - Museum Tusculanum Press, 2009, 8°, 224 pp. ISBN 978-87-635-0778-3. €47.
